recipe.title: Raised Cabbage Pie
recipe.description: I added the garlic and tarragon, which I love with cabbage, thinking that the seasoning in the original was a bit subtle for my taste. Others add dill instead, and a layer of cream cheese at the bottom. Even with these additions, this pie benefits from being served with a sharpish sauce, or something pickled. I served it with a sourcream/horseradish mixture; something mustardy would also be good.
recipe.directions: > Whisk yeast into water, then add flour, salt and butter. Mix at lowest speed for 2 mins, then rest covered 10 mins Mix at medium speed 3/4 mins until smooth. Put in buttered bowl, ensuring it gets covered in butter all over. Leave to rise 1 hr, until doubled Hardboli eggs and chop. Toss the cabbage with salt, and wring it out to get as much moisture out as possble. Melt butter, add cabbage, tarragon, garlic and sugar, and cook down, stirring until cabbage is wilted and reduced, and fairly soft. Cool and fold in eggs Divide the dough in half. On a floured surface, roll the dough to a 25cm disk, handling as little as possible. If it is resistant, let it rest a bit before trying to extend it further. Transfer dough to parchment covered cake tray, and spread filling over it, leaving an outside border of one inch. Grate fresh black pepper over all. roll out the 2nd half of the dough as you did the first and put on top of filling. Brush the outer rim of the bottom crust with water. Press around the edges firmly, and roll both crusts in toward the center 1/2". Squash the edges together with a fork, to seal. Cut several vent holes in top crust. Brush all over with water, and bake about 30 minutes, until it is a nice golden color. Serve at room temperature >
